Who has a USPS License to manufacture CBUs?

Auth-Florence was founded in 1934 while Salsbury Industries began in 1936. Both have the exclusive license from the USPS to manufacture Cluster Box Units (CBUs) in the USA. CBUs from both manufacturers are relatively identical in both design and quality.

Where are they different?
  • Pricing - Salsbury Industries CBUs tend to have higher prices.
  • Lead times - Florence CBUs typically ship in 1-3 weeks while Salsbury CBUs tend to ship quicker in about 3-5 business days.
  • Finishes - Florence offers CBUs in four architectural finishes: Sandstone, Postal Grey, Bronze, and Black. Salsbury offers these four finishes as well as White and Green.
  • Options - While Auth-Florence CBUs can be purchased without pedestals (reducing the price), the Salsbury CBU can only be purchased with the included pedestal.

While pricing, lead time, finishes, and options are similar, they are not the same between the factories.

For example, sometimes Salsbury ships CBUs faster than Florence (or vice versa). Also, the manufacturer controls their own pricing, so often one brand may cost more than the other.

BudgetMailboxes has you covered. We keep it simple. We sell you the CBU from the manufacturer that is the cheapest and we give you transparent, up-to-date lead times once your order is placed.

What types of customers purchase Cluster Mailboxes?

Over the past nine years, we have serviced all types of properties. CBUs are commonly installed at the following:

  • Apartment Complexes
  • Homeowners Associations
  • Municipalities
  • Universities
  • Commercial Developments
  • Small Businesses

We are proud to supply CBUs to some of the nation's most respected cities and companies. Here are some of our recent notable customers.

Shipping and Delivery Information

Shipping Box Dimensions & Weight

In the table below, you will find the estimated shipping box dimensions and shipping weight for each CBU type.

Capacity (type)Est. box dimensionsEst. ship weight
8-Door CBU - Type I31.5 in. W x 35 in. H x 19 in. D144 lb.
12-Door CBU - Type II31.5 in. W x 35 in. H x 19 in. D144 lb.
13-Door CBU - Type IV31.5 in. W x 49 in. H x 19 in. D167 lb.
16-Door CBU - Type III31.5 in. W x 49 in. H x 19 in. D175 lb.
4-Door CBU - Type V31.5 in. W x 35 in. H x 19 in. D145 lb.
8-Door 4-Parcel - Type VI31.5 in. W x 49 in. H x 19 in. D176 lb.
Type I and II Pedestal13 in. W x 29.5 in. H x 13 in. D15 lb.
Type III and IV Pedestal13 in. W x 15.5 in. H x 13 in. D15 lb.

What to expect when your package arrives

We want your delivery experience to be as worry-free as possible. So, to that end, here are some important notes about what to expect when your cluster mailboxes are delivered:

  • The CBU Cabinet and Pedestal will ship in two (2) separate boxes (see table above).
  • The CBU and Pedestal will ship via Freight Carrier. They normally do not ship UPS or FedEx ground.
  • The Freight Carrier will call you at least one day in advance to schedule the delivery at your location.
  • You will need to be present at the time of delivery to inspect packaging and sign for the delivery.

Outdoor Parcel Lockers - A Comprehensive Comparison

Florence & Salsbury USPS Approved Outdoor Parcel Lockers

Industry unique package delivery systems with key trapping locks can be used alone or with your CBU installation for better convenience. Below we list the available parcel lockers by both Auth-Florence and Salsbury Industries.

Auth-Florence USPS Approved Parcel Lockers

  • 1590T1SD

  • 1590T1DB

  • 1590T1PG

  • 1590T1BK

  • 1590T2SD

  • 1590T2BK

  • 1590T2PG

  • 1590T2DB

Salsbury Industries USPS Approved Parcel Lockers

  • 3302SAN-U

  • 3302GRY-U

  • 3302BRZ-U

  • 3302WHT-U

  • 3302GRN-U

Key Manufacturer Notes:

  • Auth-Florence is the Sole Source Supplier to the USPS, meaning they are the only manufacturer authorized to supply cluster box units, outdoor parcel lockers, replacement pedestals, and parts directly to the USPS.
  • Auth-Florence is also the only company to manufacture the 1590-T2 Parcel Locker with Four (4) instead of Two (2) Parcel Locker doors.
  • Salsbury Industries manufactures the 3302 Parcel Locker, which is USPS Approved for outdoor parcel delivery.
  • Private delivery models are also available for both manufacturers.
Manufacturer Model # Installed Height Installed Width Installed Depth Pedestal Height Weight (LBS) Parcel Compartment Dimensions Parcel Lockers
Auth-Florence1590-T1XX62 in.16 in.18 in.14 - ½ in.10019 - ⅝ in. H x 12 in. W x 15 in. D2
Auth-Florence1590-T2XX62 in.30 - ½ in.18 in.14 - ½ in.13919 - ⅝ in. H x 12 in. W x 15 in. D4
Salsbury Ind.3302XXX62 in.16 in.18 in.14 - ½ in.10019 - ⅝ in. H x 12 in. W x 15 in. D2
Note: for Auth-Florence, exchange "XX" in Model #s above for two digit color references: Black (BK), Dark Bronze (DB), Sandstone (SD), Postal Grey (PG). For Salsbury Industries, exchange the "XXX" for these color references: Sandstone (SAN), Black (BLK), Bronze (BRZ), Grey (GRY), Green (GRN), White (WHT).

Who has a USPS License to manufacture CBUs?

Auth-Florence was founded in 1934 while Salsbury Industries began in 1936. Both have the exclusive license from the USPS to manufacture Cluster Box Units (CBUs) in the USA. CBUs from both manufacturers are relatively identical in both design and quality.

Where are they different?
  • Pricing - Salsbury Industries CBUs tend to have higher prices.
  • Lead times - Florence CBUs typically ship in 1-3 weeks while Salsbury CBUs tend to ship quicker in about 3-5 business days.
  • Finishes - Florence offers CBUs in four architectural finishes: Sandstone, Postal Grey, Bronze, and Black. Salsbury offers these four finishes as well as White and Green.
  • Options - While Auth-Florence CBUs can be purchased without pedestals (reducing the price), the Salsbury CBU can only be purchased with the included pedestal.

While pricing, lead time, finishes, and options are similar, they are not the same between the factories.

For example, sometimes Salsbury ships CBUs faster than Florence (or vice versa). Also, the manufacturer controls their own pricing, so often one brand may cost more than the other.

BudgetMailboxes has you covered. We keep it simple. We sell you the CBU from the manufacturer that is the cheapest and we give you transparent, up-to-date lead times once your order is placed.

What types of customers purchase Cluster Mailboxes?

Over the past nine years, we have serviced all types of properties. CBUs are commonly installed at the following:

  • Apartment Complexes
  • Homeowners Associations
  • Municipalities
  • Universities
  • Commercial Developments
  • Small Businesses

We are proud to supply CBUs to some of the nation's most respected cities and companies. Here are some of our recent notable customers.

  • The CBU and Pedestal will ship via Freight Carrier. They normally do not ship UPS or FedEx ground.
  • The Freight Carrier will call you at least one day in advance to schedule the delivery at your location.
  • You will need to be present at the time of delivery to inspect packaging and sign for the delivery.

Who has a USPS License to manufacture CBUs?

Auth-Florence was founded in 1934 while Salsbury Industries began in 1936. Both have the exclusive license from the USPS to manufacture Cluster Box Units (CBUs) in the USA. CBUs from both manufacturers are relatively identical in both design and quality.

Where are they different?
  • Pricing - Salsbury Industries CBUs tend to have higher prices.
  • Lead times - Florence CBUs typically ship in 1-3 weeks while Salsbury CBUs tend to ship quicker in about 3-5 business days.
  • Finishes - Florence offers CBUs in four architectural finishes: Sandstone, Postal Grey, Bronze, and Black. Salsbury offers these four finishes as well as White and Green.
  • Options - While Auth-Florence CBUs can be purchased without pedestals (reducing the price), the Salsbury CBU can only be purchased with the included pedestal.

While pricing, lead time, finishes, and options are similar, they are not the same between the factories.

For example, sometimes Salsbury ships CBUs faster than Florence (or vice versa). Also, the manufacturer controls their own pricing, so often one brand may cost more than the other.

BudgetMailboxes has you covered. We keep it simple. We sell you the CBU from the manufacturer that is the cheapest and we give you transparent, up-to-date lead times once your order is placed.

What types of customers purchase Cluster Mailboxes?

Over the past nine years, we have serviced all types of properties. CBUs are commonly installed at the following:

  • Apartment Complexes
  • Homeowners Associations
  • Municipalities
  • Universities
  • Commercial Developments
  • Small Businesses

We are proud to supply CBUs to some of the nation's most respected cities and companies. Here are some of our recent notable customers.

Auth-Florence was founded in 1934 and has an exclusive license from the USPS to manufacture Cluster Box Units (CBUs) in the USA.

Key Features of the Florence Brand:
  • Pricing - Auth-Florence CBUs are the best-priced CBUs available online.
  • Lead times - Florence CBUs typically ship in 1-3 weeks. For custom numbering, units typically ship no earlier than 3 weeks after the order is placed.
  • Finishes - Florence offers CBUs in four architectural finishes: Sandstone, Postal Grey, Bronze, and Black.

Options - Auth-Florence CBUs can be purchased without pedestals (reducing the price), with Private Conversion Locks, and with Anchor Bolts for installation (prior pouring the concrete pad).

What types of customers purchase Cluster Mailboxes?

Over the past nine years, we have serviced all types of properties. CBUs are commonly installed at the following:

  • Apartment Complexes
  • Homeowners Associations
  • Municipalities
  • Universities
  • Commercial Developments
  • Small Businesses

We are proud to supply CBUs to some of the nation's most respected cities and companies. Here are some of our recent notable customers.

Shipping and Delivery Information

Shipping Box Dimensions & Weight

In the table below, you will find the estimated shipping box dimensions and shipping weight for each CBU type.

Capacity (type)Est. box dimensionsEst. ship weight
8-Door CBU - Type I31.5 in. W x 35 in. H x 19 in. D144 lb.
12-Door CBU - Type II31.5 in. W x 35 in. H x 19 in. D144 lb.
13-Door CBU - Type IV31.5 in. W x 49 in. H x 19 in. D167 lb.
16-Door CBU - Type III31.5 in. W x 49 in. H x 19 in. D175 lb.
4-Door CBU - Type V31.5 in. W x 35 in. H x 19 in. D145 lb.
8-Door 4-Parcel - Type VI31.5 in. W x 49 in. H x 19 in. D176 lb.
Type I and II Pedestal13 in. W x 29.5 in. H x 13 in. D15 lb.
Type III and IV Pedestal13 in. W x 15.5 in. H x 13 in. D15 lb.

What to expect when your package arrives

We want your delivery experience to be as worry-free as possible. So, to that end, here are some important notes about what to expect when your cluster mailboxes are delivered:

  • The CBU Cabinet and Pedestal will ship in two (2) separate boxes (see table above).
  • The CBU and Pedestal will ship via Freight Carrier. They normally do not ship UPS or FedEx ground.
  • The Freight Carrier will call you at least one day in advance to schedule the delivery at your location.
  • You will need to be present at the time of delivery to inspect packaging and sign for the delivery.

Who has a USPS License to manufacture CBUs?

Auth-Florence was founded in 1934 while Salsbury Industries began in 1936. Both have the exclusive license from the USPS to manufacture Cluster Box Units (CBUs) in the USA. CBUs from both manufacturers are relatively identical in both design and quality.

Where are they different?
  • Pricing - Salsbury Industries CBUs tend to have higher prices.
  • Lead times - Florence CBUs typically ship in 1-3 weeks while Salsbury CBUs tend to ship quicker in about 3-5 business days.
  • Finishes - Florence offers CBUs in four architectural finishes: Sandstone, Postal Grey, Bronze, and Black. Salsbury offers these four finishes as well as White and Green.
  • Options - While Auth-Florence CBUs can be purchased without pedestals (reducing the price), the Salsbury CBU can only be purchased with the included pedestal.

While pricing, lead time, finishes, and options are similar, they are not the same between the factories.

For example, sometimes Salsbury ships CBUs faster than Florence (or vice versa). Also, the manufacturer controls their own pricing, so often one brand may cost more than the other.

BudgetMailboxes has you covered. We keep it simple. We sell you the CBU from the manufacturer that is the cheapest and we give you transparent, up-to-date lead times once your order is placed.

Who has a USPS License to manufacture CBUs?

Auth-Florence was founded in 1934 while Salsbury Industries began in 1936. Both have the exclusive license from the USPS to manufacture Cluster Box Units (CBUs) in the USA. CBUs from both manufacturers are relatively identical in both design and quality.

Where are they different?
  • Pricing - Salsbury Industries CBUs tend to have higher prices.
  • Lead times - Florence CBUs typically ship in 1-3 weeks while Salsbury CBUs tend to ship quicker in about 3-5 business days.
  • Finishes - Florence offers CBUs in four architectural finishes: Sandstone, Postal Grey, Bronze, and Black. Salsbury offers these four finishes as well as White and Green.
  • Options - While Auth-Florence CBUs can be purchased without pedestals (reducing the price), the Salsbury CBU can only be purchased with the included pedestal.

While pricing, lead time, finishes, and options are similar, they are not the same between the factories.

For example, sometimes Salsbury ships CBUs faster than Florence (or vice versa). Also, the manufacturer controls their own pricing, so often one brand may cost more than the other.

BudgetMailboxes has you covered. We keep it simple. We sell you the CBU from the manufacturer that is the cheapest and we give you transparent, up-to-date lead times once your order is placed.

Who has a USPS License to manufacture CBUs?

Auth-Florence was founded in 1934 while Salsbury Industries began in 1936. Both have the exclusive license from the USPS to manufacture Cluster Box Units (CBUs) in the USA. CBUs from both manufacturers are relatively identical in both design and quality.

Where are they different?
  • Pricing - Salsbury Industries CBUs tend to have higher prices.
  • Lead times - Florence CBUs typically ship in 1-3 weeks while Salsbury CBUs tend to ship quicker in about 3-5 business days.
  • Finishes - Florence offers CBUs in four architectural finishes: Sandstone, Postal Grey, Bronze, and Black. Salsbury offers these four finishes as well as White and Green.
  • Options - While Auth-Florence CBUs can be purchased without pedestals (reducing the price), the Salsbury CBU can only be purchased with the included pedestal.

While pricing, lead time, finishes, and options are similar, they are not the same between the factories.

For example, sometimes Salsbury ships CBUs faster than Florence (or vice versa). Also, the manufacturer controls their own pricing, so often one brand may cost more than the other.

BudgetMailboxes has you covered. We keep it simple. We sell you the CBU from the manufacturer that is the cheapest and we give you transparent, up-to-date lead times once your order is placed.

What types of customers purchase Cluster Mailboxes?

Over the past nine years, we have serviced all types of properties. CBUs are commonly installed at the following:

  • Apartment Complexes
  • Homeowners Associations
  • Municipalities
  • Universities
  • Commercial Developments
  • Small Businesses

We are proud to supply CBUs to some of the nation's most respected cities and companies. Here are some of our recent notable customers.

  • Lead times - Salsbury CBUs tend to ship in about 3-5 business days, which puts them as the fastest manufacturer in the country for turnover time.
  • Finishes - Salsbury offers CBUs in six (6) architectural finishes: Sandstone, Bronze, Black, Grey, White, and Green.

Options - the Salsbury CBU always includes the pedestal and can be configured with custom door identification.

What types of customers purchase Cluster Mailboxes?

Over the past nine years, we have serviced all types of properties. CBUs are commonly installed at the following:

  • Apartment Complexes
  • Homeowners Associations
  • Municipalities
  • Universities
  • Commercial Developments
  • Small Businesses

We are proud to supply CBUs to some of the nation's most respected cities and companies. Here are some of our recent notable customers.

Shipping and Delivery Information

Shipping Box Dimensions & Weight

In the table below, you will find the estimated shipping box dimensions and shipping weight for each CBU type.

Capacity (type)Est. box dimensionsEst. ship weight
8-Door CBU - Type I31.5 in. W x 35 in. H x 19 in. D144 lb.
12-Door CBU - Type II31.5 in. W x 35 in. H x 19 in. D144 lb.
13-Door CBU - Type IV31.5 in. W x 49 in. H x 19 in. D167 lb.
16-Door CBU - Type III31.5 in. W x 49 in. H x 19 in. D175 lb.
4-Door CBU - Type V31.5 in. W x 35 in. H x 19 in. D145 lb.
8-Door 4-Parcel - Type VI31.5 in. W x 49 in. H x 19 in. D176 lb.
Type I and II Pedestal13 in. W x 29.5 in. H x 13 in. D15 lb.
Type III and IV Pedestal13 in. W x 15.5 in. H x 13 in. D15 lb.

What to expect when your package arrives

We want your delivery experience to be as worry-free as possible. So, to that end, here are some important notes about what to expect when your cluster mailboxes are delivered:

  • The CBU Cabinet and Pedestal will ship in two (2) separate boxes (see table above).
  • The CBU and Pedestal will ship via Freight Carrier. They normally do not ship UPS or FedEx ground.
  • The Freight Carrier will call you at least one day in advance to schedule the delivery at your location.
  • You will need to be present at the time of delivery to inspect packaging and sign for the delivery.

  • Lead times - Salsbury CBUs tend to ship in about 3-5 business days, which puts them as the fastest manufacturer in the country for turnover time.
  • Finishes - Salsbury offers CBUs in six (6) architectural finishes: Sandstone, Bronze, Black, Grey, White, and Green.

Options - the Salsbury CBU always includes the pedestal and can be configured with custom door identification.

What types of customers purchase Cluster Mailboxes?

Over the past nine years, we have serviced all types of properties. CBUs are commonly installed at the following:

  • Apartment Complexes
  • Homeowners Associations
  • Municipalities
  • Universities
  • Commercial Developments
  • Small Businesses

We are proud to supply CBUs to some of the nation's most respected cities and companies. Here are some of our recent notable customers.

Shipping and Delivery Information

Shipping Box Dimensions & Weight

In the table below, you will find the estimated shipping box dimensions and shipping weight for each CBU type.

Capacity (type)Est. box dimensionsEst. ship weight
8-Door CBU - Type I31.5 in. W x 35 in. H x 19 in. D144 lb.
12-Door CBU - Type II31.5 in. W x 35 in. H x 19 in. D144 lb.
13-Door CBU - Type IV31.5 in. W x 49 in. H x 19 in. D167 lb.
16-Door CBU - Type III31.5 in. W x 49 in. H x 19 in. D175 lb.
4-Door CBU - Type V31.5 in. W x 35 in. H x 19 in. D145 lb.
8-Door 4-Parcel - Type VI31.5 in. W x 49 in. H x 19 in. D176 lb.
Type I and II Pedestal13 in. W x 29.5 in. H x 13 in. D15 lb.
Type III and IV Pedestal13 in. W x 15.5 in. H x 13 in. D15 lb.

What to expect when your package arrives

We want your delivery experience to be as worry-free as possible. So, to that end, here are some important notes about what to expect when your cluster mailboxes are delivered:

  • The CBU Cabinet and Pedestal will ship in two (2) separate boxes (see table above).
  • The CBU and Pedestal will ship via Freight Carrier. They normally do not ship UPS or FedEx ground.
  • The Freight Carrier will call you at least one day in advance to schedule the delivery at your location.
  • You will need to be present at the time of delivery to inspect packaging and sign for the delivery.

Who has a USPS License to manufacture CBUs?

Auth-Florence was founded in 1934 while Salsbury Industries began in 1936. Both have the exclusive license from the USPS to manufacture Cluster Box Units (CBUs) in the USA. CBUs from both manufacturers are relatively identical in both design and quality.

Where are they different?
  • Pricing - Salsbury Industries CBUs tend to have higher prices.
  • Lead times - Florence CBUs typically ship in 1-3 weeks while Salsbury CBUs tend to ship quicker in about 3-5 business days.
  • Finishes - Florence offers CBUs in four architectural finishes: Sandstone, Postal Grey, Bronze, and Black. Salsbury offers these four finishes as well as White and Green.
  • Options - While Auth-Florence CBUs can be purchased without pedestals (reducing the price), the Salsbury CBU can only be purchased with the included pedestal.

While pricing, lead time, finishes, and options are similar, they are not the same between the factories.

For example, sometimes Salsbury ships CBUs faster than Florence (or vice versa). Also, the manufacturer controls their own pricing, so often one brand may cost more than the other.

BudgetMailboxes has you covered. We keep it simple. We sell you the CBU from the manufacturer that is the cheapest and we give you transparent, up-to-date lead times once your order is placed.

Who has a USPS License to manufacture CBUs?

Auth-Florence was founded in 1934 while Salsbury Industries began in 1936. Both have the exclusive license from the USPS to manufacture Cluster Box Units (CBUs) in the USA. CBUs from both manufacturers are relatively identical in both design and quality.

Where are they different?
  • Pricing - Salsbury Industries CBUs tend to have higher prices.
  • Lead times - Florence CBUs typically ship in 1-3 weeks while Salsbury CBUs tend to ship quicker in about 3-5 business days.
  • Finishes - Florence offers CBUs in four architectural finishes: Sandstone, Postal Grey, Bronze, and Black. Salsbury offers these four finishes as well as White and Green.
  • Options - While Auth-Florence CBUs can be purchased without pedestals (reducing the price), the Salsbury CBU can only be purchased with the included pedestal.

While pricing, lead time, finishes, and options are similar, they are not the same between the factories.

For example, sometimes Salsbury ships CBUs faster than Florence (or vice versa). Also, the manufacturer controls their own pricing, so often one brand may cost more than the other.

Options - Auth-Florence CBUs can be purchased without pedestals (reducing the price), with Private Conversion Locks, and with Anchor Bolts for installation (prior pouring the concrete pad).

  • Commercial Developments
  • Small Businesses

We are proud to supply CBUs to some of the nation's most respected cities and companies. Here are some of our recent notable customers.

Brand Features:
  • Lead times - Salsbury CBUs tend to ship in about 3-5 business days, which puts them as the fastest manufacturer in the country for turnover time.
  • Finishes - Salsbury offers Regency CBUs in five (5) architectural finishes: Sandstone, Bronze, Black, Grey, White, and Green.

Options - the Salsbury CBU always includes the pedestal and can be configured with custom door identification.

What types of customers purchase Cluster Mailboxes?

Over the past nine years, we have serviced all types of properties. CBUs are commonly installed at the following:

  • Apartment Complexes
  • Homeowners Associations
  • Municipalities
  • Universities
  • Commercial Developments
  • Small Businesses

We are proud to supply CBUs to some of the nation's most respected cities and companies. Here are some of our recent notable customers.

Shipping and Delivery Information

Shipping Box Dimensions & Weight

In the table below, you will find the estimated shipping box dimensions and shipping weight for each CBU type.

Capacity (type)Est. box dimensionsEst. ship weight
8-Door CBU - Type I31.5 in. W x 35 in. H x 19 in. D144 lb.
12-Door CBU - Type II31.5 in. W x 35 in. H x 19 in. D144 lb.
13-Door CBU - Type IV31.5 in. W x 49 in. H x 19 in. D167 lb.
16-Door CBU - Type III31.5 in. W x 49 in. H x 19 in. D175 lb.
4-Door CBU - Type V31.5 in. W x 35 in. H x 19 in. D145 lb.
8-Door 4-Parcel - Type VI31.5 in. W x 49 in. H x 19 in. D176 lb.
Type I and II Pedestal13 in. W x 29.5 in. H x 13 in. D15 lb.
Type III and IV Pedestal13 in. W x 15.5 in. H x 13 in. D15 lb.

What to expect when your package arrives

We want your delivery experience to be as worry-free as possible. So, to that end, here are some important notes about what to expect when your cluster mailboxes are delivered:

  • The CBU Cabinet and Pedestal will ship in two (2) separate boxes (see table above).
  • The CBU and Pedestal will ship via Freight Carrier. They normally do not ship UPS or FedEx ground.
  • The Freight Carrier will call you at least one day in advance to schedule the delivery at your location.
  • You will need to be present at the time of delivery to inspect packaging and sign for the delivery.

Who has a USPS License to manufacture CBUs?

Auth-Florence was founded in 1934 and has an exclusive license from the USPS to manufacture Cluster Box Units (CBUs) in the USA.

Key Features of the Florence Brand:
  • Pricing - Auth-Florence CBUs are the best-priced CBUs available online.
  • Lead times - Florence CBUs typically ship in 1-3 weeks. For custom numbering, units typically ship no earlier than 3 weeks after the order is placed.
  • Finishes - Florence offers CBUs in four architectural finishes: Sandstone, Postal Grey, Bronze, and Black.

Options - Auth-Florence CBUs can be purchased without pedestals (reducing the price), with Private Conversion Locks, and with Anchor Bolts for installation (prior pouring the concrete pad).

Who has a USPS License to manufacture CBUs?

Auth-Florence was founded in 1934 while Salsbury Industries began in 1936. Both have the exclusive license from the USPS to manufacture Cluster Box Units (CBUs) in the USA. CBUs from both manufacturers are relatively identical in both design and quality.

Where are they different?
  • Pricing - Salsbury Industries CBUs tend to have higher prices.
  • Lead times - Florence CBUs typically ship in 1-3 weeks while Salsbury CBUs tend to ship quicker in about 3-5 business days.
  • Finishes - Florence offers CBUs in four architectural finishes: Sandstone, Postal Grey, Bronze, and Black. Salsbury offers these four finishes as well as White and Green.
  • Options - While Auth-Florence CBUs can be purchased without pedestals (reducing the price), the Salsbury CBU can only be purchased with the included pedestal.

While pricing, lead time, finishes, and options are similar, they are not the same between the factories.

For example, sometimes Salsbury ships CBUs faster than Florence (or vice versa). Also, the manufacturer controls their own pricing, so often one brand may cost more than the other.

BudgetMailboxes has you covered. We keep it simple. We sell you the CBU from the manufacturer that is the cheapest and we give you transparent, up-to-date lead times once your order is placed.

Who has a USPS License to manufacture CBUs?

Auth-Florence was founded in 1934 while Salsbury Industries began in 1936. Both have the exclusive license from the USPS to manufacture Cluster Box Units (CBUs) in the USA. CBUs from both manufacturers are relatively identical in both design and quality.

Where are they different?
  • Pricing - Salsbury Industries CBUs tend to have higher prices.
  • Lead times - Florence CBUs typically ship in 1-3 weeks while Salsbury CBUs tend to ship quicker in about 3-5 business days.
  • Finishes - Florence offers CBUs in four architectural finishes: Sandstone, Postal Grey, Bronze, and Black. Salsbury offers these four finishes as well as White and Green.
  • Options - While Auth-Florence CBUs can be purchased without pedestals (reducing the price), the Salsbury CBU can only be purchased with the included pedestal.

While pricing, lead time, finishes, and options are similar, they are not the same between the factories.

For example, sometimes Salsbury ships CBUs faster than Florence (or vice versa). Also, the manufacturer controls their own pricing, so often one brand may cost more than the other.

BudgetMailboxes has you covered. We keep it simple. We sell you the CBU from the manufacturer that is the cheapest and we give you transparent, up-to-date lead times once your order is placed.

Who has a USPS License to manufacture CBUs?

Auth-Florence was founded in 1934 while Salsbury Industries began in 1936. Both have the exclusive license from the USPS to manufacture Cluster Box Units (CBUs) in the USA. CBUs from both manufacturers are relatively identical in both design and quality.

Where are they different?
  • Pricing - Salsbury Industries CBUs tend to have higher prices.
  • Lead times - Florence CBUs typically ship in 1-3 weeks while Salsbury CBUs tend to ship quicker in about 3-5 business days.
  • Finishes - Florence offers CBUs in four architectural finishes: Sandstone, Postal Grey, Bronze, and Black. Salsbury offers these four finishes as well as White and Green.
  • Options - While Auth-Florence CBUs can be purchased without pedestals (reducing the price), the Salsbury CBU can only be purchased with the included pedestal.

While pricing, lead time, finishes, and options are similar, they are not the same between the factories.

For example, sometimes Salsbury ships CBUs faster than Florence (or vice versa). Also, the manufacturer controls their own pricing, so often one brand may cost more than the other.

BudgetMailboxes has you covered. We keep it simple. We sell you the CBU from the manufacturer that is the cheapest and we give you transparent, up-to-date lead times once your order is placed.

Who has a USPS License to manufacture CBUs?

Auth-Florence was founded in 1934 while Salsbury Industries began in 1936. Both have the exclusive license from the USPS to manufacture Cluster Box Units (CBUs) in the USA. CBUs from both manufacturers are relatively identical in both design and quality.

Where are they different?
  • Pricing - Salsbury Industries CBUs tend to have higher prices.
  • Lead times - Florence CBUs typically ship in 1-3 weeks while Salsbury CBUs tend to ship quicker in about 3-5 business days.
  • Finishes - Florence offers CBUs in four architectural finishes: Sandstone, Postal Grey, Bronze, and Black. Salsbury offers these four finishes as well as White and Green.
  • Options - While Auth-Florence CBUs can be purchased without pedestals (reducing the price), the Salsbury CBU can only be purchased with the included pedestal.

While pricing, lead time, finishes, and options are similar, they are not the same between the factories.

For example, sometimes Salsbury ships CBUs faster than Florence (or vice versa). Also, the manufacturer controls their own pricing, so often one brand may cost more than the other.

BudgetMailboxes has you covered. We keep it simple. We sell you the CBU from the manufacturer that is the cheapest and we give you transparent, up-to-date lead times once your order is placed.

What types of customers purchase Cluster Mailboxes?

Over the past nine years, we have serviced all types of properties. CBUs are commonly installed at the following:

  • Apartment Complexes
  • Homeowners Associations
  • Municipalities
  • Universities
  • Commercial Developments
  • Small Businesses

We are proud to supply CBUs to some of the nation's most respected cities and companies. Here are some of our recent notable customers.

Who has a USPS License to manufacture CBUs?

Auth-Florence was founded in 1934 while Salsbury Industries began in 1936. Both have the exclusive license from the USPS to manufacture Cluster Box Units (CBUs) in the USA. CBUs from both manufacturers are relatively identical in both design and quality.

Where are they different?
  • Pricing - Salsbury Industries CBUs tend to have higher prices.
  • Lead times - Florence CBUs typically ship in 1-3 weeks while Salsbury CBUs tend to ship quicker in about 3-5 business days.
  • Finishes - Florence offers CBUs in four architectural finishes: Sandstone, Postal Grey, Bronze, and Black. Salsbury offers these four finishes as well as White and Green.
  • Options - While Auth-Florence CBUs can be purchased without pedestals (reducing the price), the Salsbury CBU can only be purchased with the included pedestal.

While pricing, lead time, finishes, and options are similar, they are not the same between the factories.

For example, sometimes Salsbury ships CBUs faster than Florence (or vice versa). Also, the manufacturer controls their own pricing, so often one brand may cost more than the other.

BudgetMailboxes has you covered. We keep it simple. We sell you the CBU from the manufacturer that is the cheapest and we give you transparent, up-to-date lead times once your order is placed.

What types of customers purchase Cluster Mailboxes?

Over the past nine years, we have serviced all types of properties. CBUs are commonly installed at the following:

  • Apartment Complexes
  • Homeowners Associations
  • Municipalities
  • Universities
  • Commercial Developments
  • Small Businesses

We are proud to supply CBUs to some of the nation's most respected cities and companies. Here are some of our recent notable customers.

We want your delivery experience to be as worry-free as possible. So, to that end, here are some important notes about what to expect when your cluster mailboxes are delivered:

  • The CBU Cabinet and Pedestal will ship in two (2) separate boxes (see table above).
  • The CBU and Pedestal will ship via Freight Carrier. They normally do not ship UPS or FedEx ground.
  • The Freight Carrier will call you at least one day in advance to schedule the delivery at your location.
  • You will need to be present at the time of delivery to inspect packaging and sign for the delivery.

Who has a USPS License to manufacture CBUs?

Auth-Florence was founded in 1934 while Salsbury Industries began in 1936. Both have the exclusive license from the USPS to manufacture Cluster Box Units (CBUs) in the USA. CBUs from both manufacturers are relatively identical in both design and quality.

Where are they different?
  • Pricing - Salsbury Industries CBUs tend to have higher prices.
  • Lead times - Florence CBUs typically ship in 1-3 weeks while Salsbury CBUs tend to ship quicker in about 3-5 business days.
  • Finishes - Florence offers CBUs in four architectural finishes: Sandstone, Postal Grey, Bronze, and Black. Salsbury offers these four finishes as well as White and Green.
  • Options - While Auth-Florence CBUs can be purchased without pedestals (reducing the price), the Salsbury CBU can only be purchased with the included pedestal.

While pricing, lead time, finishes, and options are similar, they are not the same between the factories.

For example, sometimes Salsbury ships CBUs faster than Florence (or vice versa). Also, the manufacturer controls their own pricing, so often one brand may cost more than the other.

BudgetMailboxes has you covered. We keep it simple. We sell you the CBU from the manufacturer that is the cheapest and we give you transparent, up-to-date lead times once your order is placed.

Over the past nine years, we have serviced all types of properties. CBUs are commonly installed at the following:

  • Small Businesses

We are proud to supply CBUs to some of the nation's most respected cities and companies. Here are some of our recent notable customers.

Who has a USPS License to manufacture CBUs?

Auth-Florence was founded in 1934 while Salsbury Industries began in 1936. Both have the exclusive license from the USPS to manufacture Cluster Box Units (CBUs) in the USA. CBUs from both manufacturers are relatively identical in both design and quality.

Where are they different?
  • Pricing - Salsbury Industries CBUs tend to have higher prices.
  • Lead times - Florence CBUs typically ship in 1-3 weeks while Salsbury CBUs tend to ship quicker in about 3-5 business days.
  • Finishes - Florence offers CBUs in four architectural finishes: Sandstone, Postal Grey, Bronze, and Black. Salsbury offers these four finishes as well as White and Green.
  • Options - While Auth-Florence CBUs can be purchased without pedestals (reducing the price), the Salsbury CBU can only be purchased with the included pedestal.

While pricing, lead time, finishes, and options are similar, they are not the same between the factories.

For example, sometimes Salsbury ships CBUs faster than Florence (or vice versa). Also, the manufacturer controls their own pricing, so often one brand may cost more than the other.

BudgetMailboxes has you covered. We keep it simple. We sell you the CBU from the manufacturer that is the cheapest and we give you transparent, up-to-date lead times once your order is placed.

Who has a USPS License to manufacture CBUs?

Auth-Florence was founded in 1934 while Salsbury Industries began in 1936. Both have the exclusive license from the USPS to manufacture Cluster Box Units (CBUs) in the USA. CBUs from both manufacturers are relatively identical in both design and quality.

Where are they different?
  • Pricing - Salsbury Industries CBUs tend to have higher prices.
  • Lead times - Florence CBUs typically ship in 1-3 weeks while Salsbury CBUs tend to ship quicker in about 3-5 business days.
  • Finishes - Florence offers CBUs in four architectural finishes: Sandstone, Postal Grey, Bronze, and Black. Salsbury offers these four finishes as well as White and Green.
  • Options - While Auth-Florence CBUs can be purchased without pedestals (reducing the price), the Salsbury CBU can only be purchased with the included pedestal.

While pricing, lead time, finishes, and options are similar, they are not the same between the factories.

For example, sometimes Salsbury ships CBUs faster than Florence (or vice versa). Also, the manufacturer controls their own pricing, so often one brand may cost more than the other.

BudgetMailboxes has you covered. We keep it simple. We sell you the CBU from the manufacturer that is the cheapest and we give you transparent, up-to-date lead times once your order is placed.

What types of customers purchase Cluster Mailboxes?

Over the past nine years, we have serviced all types of properties. CBUs are commonly installed at the following:

  • Apartment Complexes
  • Homeowners Associations
  • Municipalities
  • Universities
  • Commercial Developments
  • Small Businesses

We are proud to supply CBUs to some of the nation's most respected cities and companies. Here are some of our recent notable customers.

Installation Walkthrough

Here we go over the basics of installing your cluster box into existing concrete. If you plan to install your CBU into new concrete, please see our Installation Manual below.

Note: we recommend you watch the video at the bottom of this section to get an idea of the installation process.

The Pedestal

When you open up the carton for the pedestal, you have a gasket and a template also. Follow the steps below to install your CBU pedestal into the concrete pad:

  1. Locate the center of the pad, put the mounting template down, and then start drilling your holes (using the template).
  2. Drill down at least five and three-quarters with a half-inch drill bit.*
  3. Make sure the surface is clear of rocks and debris.
  4. Once the area is clean, place the gasket down on the concrete (this serves as a barrier between the cement and the pedestal).
  5. Now place the pedestal on top of the gasket. If it's not level, you can add washers to the uneven side.
  6. Once the pedestal is level, you can place your anchors, which are five and a half inches long by one-half inch wide.**
  7. Place the anchors into the holes and torque the bolts down until they're tight using a socket wrench (you can also use an impact wrench to tighten the bolts).
  8. Once you've tightened the bolts, double check that the pedestal is level.

* In the tutorial video, the installer drills down 4-1/2 inches.

** In the same tutorial video, the installer uses anchors that are 4-1/4 inches long. Our anchor bolts are 5-1/2 inches long, according to the manufacturer's minimum requirements.

The Cluster Box

Upon receiving the boxes, open them up to make sure there's no damage. Two people should place the box on the pedestal stand: one person can hold the box while the other person fastens it to the pedestal.

To fasten the box:

  • Inside the box, there will be access plates in the parcel locker(s). Go ahead and slide those out.
  • This will allow you to access the hardware to secure the box to the pedestal.
  • Place the washer on the bolt, followed by the nut. Do this to all four top bolts.
  • Ratchet the nuts with a nine-sixteenths (9/16) socket wrench.
  • Once these bolts are tight, return the access plates you removed from the parcel locker(s) in step one to cover the hardware.

Once complete, close up the box. Now, you will need to contact the post office to send someone to install their arrow locks for USPS access. The postman will install one arrow lock in the outgoing mail slot, and one in each parcel locker.

Heavy-Duty Cam Lock

Parcel locker doors feature a stainless steel heavy-duty five-pin cylinder cam lock with a dust and rain shield, along with three (3) keys. This simple yet effective locking mechanism provides the needed security to keep your package safe until you retrieve it.

If you ever need to replace one of the cam locks, the process is very straightforward. Watch the video below to see how you can replace one of these locks within minutes.

Opening the Master Doors & Locating Your Keys

  • Parcel lockers are accessed from the front through the easy-to-open master door panel.
  • Watch the video to see how to open the master door and locate your keys (hint: the keys are taped to the inside of your box, inside one of the parcel lockers).

See the corresponding video for more details.

Installation Walkthrough

Here, we go over the basics of installing your cluster box into existing concrete. If you plan to install your CBU into new concrete, please see our Installation Manual below.

Note: we recommend you watch the video at the bottom of this section to get an idea of the installation process.

The Pedestal

When you open up the carton for the pedestal, you have a gasket and a template also. Follow the steps below to install your CBU pedestal into the concrete pad:

  1. Locate the center of the pad, put the mounting template down, and then start drilling your holes (using the template).
  2. Drill down at least five and three-quarters with a half-inch drill bit.*
  3. Make sure the surface is clear of rocks and debris.
  4. Once the area is clean, place the gasket down on the concrete (this serves as a barrier between the cement and the pedestal).
  5. Now place the pedestal on top of the gasket. If it's not level, you can add washers to the uneven side.
  6. Once the pedestal is level, you can place your anchors, which are five and a half inches long by one-half inch wide.**
  7. Place the anchors into the holes and torque the bolts down until they're tight using a socket wrench (you can also use an impact wrench to tighten the bolts).
  8. Once you've tightened the bolts, double check that the pedestal is level.

* In the tutorial video, the installer drills down 4-1/2 inches.

** In the same tutorial video, the installer uses anchors that are 4-1/4 inches long. Our anchor bolts are 5-1/2 inches long, according to the manufacturer's minimum requirements.

The Cluster Box

Upon receiving the boxes, open them up to make sure there's no damage. Two people should place the box on the pedestal stand: one person can hold the box while the other person fastens it to the pedestal.

To fasten the box:

  • Inside the box, there will be access plates in the parcel locker(s). Go ahead and slide those out.
  • This will allow you to access the hardware to secure the box to the pedestal.
  • Place the washer on the bolt, followed by the nut. Do this to all four top bolts.
  • Ratchet the nuts with a nine-sixteenths (9/16) socket wrench.
  • Once these bolts are tight, return the access plates you removed from the parcel locker(s) in step one to cover the hardware.

Once complete, close up the box. Now, you will need to contact the post office to send someone to install their arrow locks for USPS access. The postman will install one arrow lock in the outgoing mail slot, and one in each parcel locker.

Installation Walkthrough

Here, we go over the basics of installing your cluster box into existing concrete. If you plan to install your CBU into new concrete, please see our Installation Manual below.

Note: we recommend you watch the video at the bottom of this section to get an idea of the installation process.

The Pedestal

When you open up the carton for the pedestal, you have a gasket and a template also. Follow the steps below to install your CBU pedestal into the concrete pad:

  1. Locate the center of the pad, put the mounting template down, and then start drilling your holes (using the template).
  2. Drill down at least five and three-quarters with a half-inch drill bit.*
  3. Make sure the surface is clear of rocks and debris.
  4. Once the area is clean, place the gasket down on the concrete (this serves as a barrier between the cement and the pedestal).
  5. Now place the pedestal on top of the gasket. If it's not level, you can add washers to the uneven side.
  6. Once the pedestal is level, you can place your anchors, which are five and a half inches long by one-half inch wide.**
  7. Place the anchors into the holes and torque the bolts down until they're tight using a socket wrench (you can also use an impact wrench to tighten the bolts).
  8. Once you've tightened the bolts, double check that the pedestal is level.

* In the tutorial video, the installer drills down 4-1/2 inches.

** In the same tutorial video, the installer uses anchors that are 4-1/4 inches long. Our anchor bolts are 5-1/2 inches long, according to the manufacturer's minimum requirements.

The Cluster Box

Upon receiving the boxes, open them up to make sure there's no damage. Two people should place the box on the pedestal stand: one person can hold the box while the other person fastens it to the pedestal.

To fasten the box:

  • Inside the box, there will be access plates in the parcel locker(s). Go ahead and slide those out.
  • This will allow you to access the hardware to secure the box to the pedestal.
  • Place the washer on the bolt, followed by the nut. Do this to all four top bolts.
  • Ratchet the nuts with a nine-sixteenths (9/16) socket wrench.
  • Once these bolts are tight, return the access plates you removed from the parcel locker(s) in step one to cover the hardware.

Once complete, close up the box. Now, you will need to contact the post office to send someone to install their arrow locks for USPS access. The postman will install one arrow lock in the outgoing mail slot, and one in each parcel locker.

What to expect when your package arrives

We want your delivery experience to be as worry-free as possible. So, to that end, here are some important notes about what to expect when your cluster mailboxes are delivered:

  • The CBU Cabinet and Pedestal will ship in two (2) separate boxes (see table above).
  • The CBU and Pedestal will ship via Freight Carrier. They normally do not ship UPS or FedEx ground.
  • The Freight Carrier will call you at least one day in advance to schedule the delivery at your location.
  • You will need to be present at the time of delivery to inspect packaging and sign for the delivery.

Who has a USPS License to manufacture CBUs?

Salsbury Industries began manufacturing mailboxes in 1936 and has an exclusive license from the USPS to manufacture Cluster Box Units (CBUs) in the USA.

Brand Features:
  • Lead times - Salsbury CBUs tend to ship in about 3-5 business days, which puts them as the fastest manufacturer in the country for turnover time.
  • Finishes - Salsbury offers Regency CBUs in five (5) architectural finishes: Sandstone, Bronze, Black, Grey, White, and Green.

Options - the Salsbury CBU always includes the pedestal and can be configured with custom door identification.

What types of customers purchase Cluster Mailboxes?

Over the past nine years, we have serviced all types of properties. CBUs are commonly installed at the following:

  • Apartment Complexes
  • Homeowners Associations
  • Municipalities
  • Universities
  • Commercial Developments
  • Small Businesses

We are proud to supply CBUs to some of the nation's most respected cities and companies. Here are some of our recent notable customers.
